A game filled with nostalgia for me. It changes very little from the original half-life formula, and I can't really recommend this short game ( Only two hours of content) at the price of 5 dollars. However, the game goes on sale frequently for a dollar which is a far better price. 

TL;DR: Game is short. Buy on sale unless you really love half life.
A fun little spin-off of the original Half-Life.

It's a fun little side story where you play as a security guard named Barney Calhoun (who also makes appearances throughout Half-Life 2 and its Episodes) during the events of the main game. Pretty much more of the same, but if you liked Half-Life, that's not a bad thing. I thought some of the puzzles were poorly designed though. Don't feel bad if you have to look up a solution or two.

Get it when it's $1 on sale, because it only lasts about 1.5-2 hours.

So of course after finishing Half-Life & Opposing Force I only had one more experience of Half-Life to complete (Besides Decay but that isn't on steam sadly), and that was Blue Shift. Blue Shift was a lot shorter than the other games and proved to be much easier. In Blue Shift you follow my favorite character in the HL series, Barney Calhoun, and witness what he went through in the Black Mesa Incident. It was fun like the rest of the series and didn't lack action for one minute, now sure the action levels weren't as high as Opposing Force but the levels were high. This is a great short experience that breathes life into a character that would become very important in HL2. 8/10 I only wish it was a bit longer, but it was still enjoyable.

Come osservato da tanti altri giocatori, la pecca principale di Blue Shift è la breve durata e l'assenza di nuove armi/nemici (nemmeno tanti nemici, in realtà) però oh, sei a Black Mesa. ci sono scienziati dalla voce stridula e portali per Xen che spuntano come funghi. Perché no?
Ho apprezzato questo gioco e sicuramente lo rigiocherò nel tempo perso.
Soddisfatto!

If you've played Half Life, you know it was the dawn of an incredible FPS series. If you played Half Life: Opposing Force, you know it gave us new weapons, gameplay elements, story, and lore. Now with Half Life: Blue shift, you get to see the events of Half Life from a new perspective; through one of the security guards Barney Calhoun. This time, with less variety of weapons, shorter story, simpler puzzles, Blue Shift isn't really as big of a banger than the original Half Life, nor Opposing Force. But still, it introduced us to a new character, Barney Calhoun who will be a reoccuring character in future Half Life titles.

Thanks to Blue Shift and Opposing Force, Gearbox Software got kickstarted to bring us good quality games, however only a few games such as the Borderlands series is magnificent. Thanks to Valve, they are going to bring back Half Life with Half Life: Alyx. It's not what the fans asked for, we wanted Half Life 3, but we will take it. Finally after 12 years, Valve is back to working on Half Life.


Edit 18/05/2020
Valve released Half-Life:Alyx, if Half-Life 3 were to ever be released, Valve stated themselves they want it to revolutionize the video game industry so we all have to be patient.

Интересное дополнение к оригинальной халве. Неплохой сюжет, отличные локации. Здесь нет нового оружия, врагов, как это было в другом дополнении. В этой игре именно ты  наблюдаешь за происходящим с другой стороны, со стороны второстепенного персонажа. И мне это нравится. Не какой-то там ученый или обученный спецназ, а простой полицейский, который должен охранять дядек в халатах. Рекомендую к прохождению!
Ever been playing Half Life and wished you were Barney? Not the purple dinosaur, but Gordon's drinking buddy? Well, give this a try...

Granted, this one was far too short. But honestly, it was just an expansion pack... what do you expect? Bottom line, it's more Half-Life action. If you're a Half-Life fan, you have every reason to give it a chance. It's a great game, but it's just a SHORT expansion pack. Don't expect it to be what it isn't. This isn't Half-Life 2, it is Half-Life: Blue Shift ... a short little expansion that gives you another several hours of the Half-Life universe to enjoy through the eyes of a different character. Definitely worth checking out if you are looking for more Half-Life action. If not, go play the other Half-Life games instead. They are definitely better.

Druhý datadisk do původní hry Half life. Ocitnete se v roli člena ochranky, který byl v zařízení Black Mesa zrovna když do tajného zařízení Black Mesa dorazil obáváný muž Gordon Freeman. Děj se odehrává opět z jiného úhlu pohledu.

+ Příběh
+ Stručně a přehledně zpracovaný děj
+ Nové hádanky
+ Noví nepřátelé
+ Bossfighty
+ Multiplayer, který funguje dodnes
+ Možnost ukládání kdykoliv
+ Nenáročné na HW
+ Bunnyhop
+ Cena

- Herní doba (2 hodiny)
- Bugy a glitche
- Okolní zvuky většinou "přeřvávají" dialogy
- Mohly by být titulky

Hratelnost 9/10
Možnosti hry 7/10
Zabavení 9/10
Celkové zhodnocení 9/10

Now this is an interesting expansion for Half-Life. You take role as Barney Calhoun, a security officer at Black Mesa. This game is more oriented on exploring the lives of those who work at Black Mesa, rather than tons of action, like the other two HL games. It's not as great as the other two games, but definitely worth a play

Originally was made as a game mode for the Sega Dreamcast version of Half-Life that got cancelled shortly before release.  A short and sweet adventure that shows the Black Mesa incident from another perspective.

Half Life sequel developed by Gearbox Software released in 2001. A short game that has the player in the perspective of a security guard working in Black Mesa during the resonance cascade event. That security guard would later play a crucial role in Half Life 2, whilst (almost) all of the characters featured in the game will see not seen in future titles in the series. 

The game has you fighting against the some usual sets of enemies from Half Life, but since the game is much shorter than its predecessors, you don't fight as many and some only a little bit (see tank, Xen related bad guys etc.). Most of which are HECU marines, some basic aliens along with headcrabs. You also don't get all of the weapons featured from Half LIfe, such as the experimental/prototype weapons. 

Puzzles are rather basic at times and you might get lost or confused at some levels with varying pathways (which are no more difficult than any other levels from Half Life). Storyline is basic and you later have to commit to starting some machines by manual operating some valves and levers and pressing some buttons here and there to progress the plot. What's interesting is that some of the plotpoints of the final missions will be very familiar to keen Half Life 2 fans-no spoilers here!

While this game is short and rather lacking compared to the original Half Life title and Opposing Force sequel, it's still got some fun to it if you enjoy rummaging through Black Mesa. Just don't expect a game of high stature or much replay-ability.

I suggest getting this game on sale if you haven't got it bundled with other Half Life games. Despite its rave reviews, its a few hours long at most and feels more like a mod rather than a stand alone title. 

That being said, its a game if you enjoy the Half Life franchise and you have a couple hours to waste-

I recommend.
